key_title: Key to the species of Paspalidium

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Monocotyledons
Key to the genera of Poaceae

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Poaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1994). Poaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Fertile lemma with membranous margins, of distinctly thinner texture than lemma body, laying flat over palea and obscuring c. one-third of it or more; spikelets neatly and distichously arranged; racemes often longer than the axis internode and hence overlapping the base of the raceme above; locally abundant in flood-prone areas along Murray River and major tributaries downsream from Wodonga area

Fertile lemma with recurved margin, as thick-textured as body of lemma, exposing most of the palea beneath; spikelets generally not neatly and distichously arranged (except perhaps P. aversum); racemes shorter than the axis internode and not overlapping the base of the raceme above
Sterile lemma with palea c. half as long as lemma
Sterile lemma without a palea, or palea vestigial, less than one-quarter as long as lemma
Lower lemma rather thick-textured, opaque, veins inconspicuous; axis of inflorescence narrowly but distinctly winged
Lower lemma membranous, whitish-translucent except for distinct veins; axis of inflorescence not or barely winged
Lower glume shortly scabrous-pubescent; north-central to north-west Victoria, Werribee area and rain-shadowed upper Snowy River area in the east
Lower glume smooth and glabrous; only rain-shadowed upper Snowy River area in the east
